ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to work with Adobe Premiere and After Effects, how to light and film with green screen, how to key out green screen and a variety of theory that helped understand how digital video affects today's society, and also helps honing storytelling skills.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I recommend this course to anyone looking to learn or practice how to make videos for any purpose. Our class had people from architecture, the art school, computer programming, a grad student from FES - in fact none of us were film students. There was a wide range of skills and interests and we all were able to work at our own pace on projects that were interesting and important to us as individuals.

This course is a great way to engage with experimental forms of video/internet art and more - definitely gives you the opportunity to work conceptually in a way that traditional filmmaking classes don't
